qas.question: Who directs the Secretary of the Air Force during operational missions?
What does the abbreviation CHOP stand for?
Who is in charge of these Change in Operational Control missions?
Who does the AMC forces usually retain their componency to?

context: The organizational structure as shown above is responsible for the peacetime organization, equipping, and training of aerospace units for operational missions. When required to support operational missions, the <a0_0>Secretary of Defense<a0_0/> (SECDEF) directs the Secretary of the Air Force (SECAF) to execute a <a1_0>Change in Operational Control<a1_0/> (CHOP) of these units from their administrative alignment to the operational command of a <a2_0>Regional Combatant Commander<a2_0/> (CCDR). In the case of AFSPC, AFSOC, PACAF, and USAFE units, forces are normally employed in-place under their existing CCDR. Likewise, AMC forces operating in support roles retain their componency to <a3_0>USTRANSCOM<a3_0/> unless chopped to a Regional CCDR.
